name: Cardboard Building Blocks
description:
NOTE: Made for the Google Cardboard headset.

Roles of team members

○Jonathan Cope - Programmer / Scripter (Projectiles, Timer, Level Count and Score Count, creating and instantiating Prefabs (AudioSources),Background Music (not sound effects)

○Matthew Umana - Programmer / Scripter (Player Mechanics, Resources prefabs, instantiating block prefabs)

○Nick Smeraldo - Level Builder (finding art assets for the level and objects as well as building the particle effects and some of the sounds used)

Link to Design Blog

○https://buildingblockscardboard.blogspot.com/

Brief Description

○Using GoogleVR, this game allows users to play a Virtual Reality fort-building game using their own cell phone. The player simply needs to look at a wall to start building.

Objective and Instructions for how to play

○As the game starts, you are put into a room and you will immediately be placing blocks into the scene (on walls, floors, or on other blocks). An alarm will sound when a projectile will be hurdling toward you and you must build quick enough to obstruct the projectile and avoid being hit. If you succeed in building quickly enough, you will progress to the next level. However, if you are hit, it is game over.
